name: Tirupati Temple
description: Famous Vedic temple dedicated to Lord Venkateswara.

name: Araku Valley
description: Picturesque hill station known for coffee plantations and tribal culture.

name: Amaravati
description: Historic city, a center for Buddhist culture and art.

name: Gandikota (Grand Canyon of India)
description: Stunning gorge formed by River Penna, with ancient fort ruins.

name: Tawang Monastery
description: Largest monastery in India, offering breathtaking mountain views.

name: Ziro Valley
description: Lush green valley, home to the Apatani tribe, known for rice cultivation.

name: Namdapha National Park
description: Biodiversity hotspot with diverse flora and fauna, including tigers and leopards.

name: Sela Pass
description: High-altitude mountain pass offering stunning views of snow-capped peaks and lakes.

name: Kaziranga National Park
description: Home to two-thirds of the world's one-horned rhinoceroses.

name: Kamakhya Temple
description: A major Hindu pilgrimage site dedicated to Goddess Kamakhya.

name: Majuli Island
description: World's largest river island, known for its Vaishnavite culture and serene beauty.

name: Manas National Park
description: UNESCO World Heritage site, a tiger and elephant reserve.

name: Bodh Gaya
description: UNESCO site where Buddha attained Enlightenment under the Bodhi tree.

name: Nalanda University ruins
description: Ancient center of learning, showcasing rich historical and architectural heritage.

name: Rajgir
description: Historic town with Buddhist and Jain significance, hot springs, and ropeway.

name: Vaishali
description: Ancient city, considered one of the first republics, important for Buddhism and Jainism.

name: Chitrakote Falls
description: India's widest waterfall, often called the Niagara of India.

name: Barnawapara Wildlife Sanctuary
description: Rich in diverse flora and fauna, including tigers, leopards, and sloth bears.

name: Bhoramdeo Temple
description: Ancient temple complex dedicated to Lord Shiva, known as the Khajuraho of Chhattisgarh.

name: Sirpur
description: Archaeological site with ancient temples, monasteries, and Buddhist viharas.

name: Baga and Calangute Beaches
description: Famous beaches known for vibrant nightlife, water sports, and shacks.

name: Basilica of Bom Jesus
description: UNESCO World Heritage site, holding the mortal remains of St. Francis Xavier.

name: Fort Aguada
description: Well-preserved 17th-century Portuguese fort with a lighthouse.

name: Dudhsagar Waterfalls
description: Majestic four-tiered waterfall located on the Mandovi River.

name: Gir National Park
description: The only natural habitat of the Asiatic lions in the world.

name: Somnath Temple
description: One of the 12 Jyotirlingas, located on the Arabian Sea coast.

name: Rann of Kutch
description: Vast salt marsh hosting the Rann Utsav with cultural programs and desert safari.

name: Statue of Unity
description: World’s tallest statue dedicated to Sardar Vallabhbhai Patel.

name: Kurukshetra
description: The legendary battlefield of Mahabharata and a prominent pilgrimage center.

name: Sultanpur National Park
description: Popular bird sanctuary attracting migratory species from Europe and Siberia.

name: Panipat
description: Historical city known for three major battles that shaped Indian history.

name: Morni Hills
description: Haryana’s only hill station, ideal for trekking and boating amidst nature.

name: Shimla
description: Popular hill station, former summer capital of British India.

name: Manali
description: Famous for adventure sports, snow-capped mountains, and scenic beauty.

name: Spiti Valley
description: Cold desert mountain valley known for its monasteries and stark landscapes.

name: Dharamshala
description: Home to the Dalai Lama and Tibetan government-in-exile, surrounded by cedar forests.

name: Netarhat
description: Hill station known as the "Queen of Chotanagpur", famous for sunrise and sunset views.

name: Hundru Falls
description: One of the highest waterfalls in Jharkhand, created by the Subarnarekha River.

name: Baidyanath Temple (Deoghar)
description: One of the twelve Jyotirlingas, a major pilgrimage site for Hindus.

name: Betla National Park
description: Rich in biodiversity, home to tigers, elephants, and various other wildlife.

name: Hampi
description: UNESCO site with ruins of the Vijayanagara Empire.

name: Mysore Palace
description: Grand historical palace, the official residence of the Wadiyar dynasty.

name: Coorg (Kodagu)
description: Hill station known for its coffee plantations, misty hills, and waterfalls.

name: Gokarna
description: Coastal town famous for its pristine beaches and Mahabaleshwar Temple.

name: Munnar
description: Hill station with sprawling tea plantations and misty mountains.

name: Alleppey (Alappuzha) Backwaters
description: Famous for houseboat cruises through serene backwaters.

name: Kochi (Cochin)
description: Port city with a rich history, known for Chinese fishing nets and colonial architecture.

name: Wayanad
description: Green paradise with waterfalls, caves, wildlife sanctuaries, and spice plantations.

name: Khajuraho Temples
description: UNESCO site famous for intricate sculptures and Nagara-style architecture.

name: Bandhavgarh National Park
description: Known for its high density of Bengal tigers and diverse wildlife.

name: Sanchi Stupa
description: Great Buddhist stupa, a UNESCO World Heritage site.

name: Pachmarhi
description: Hill station known as 'Satpura ki Rani', with waterfalls, caves, and forests.

name: Ajanta & Ellora Caves
description: UNESCO sites with rock-cut caves showcasing Buddhist, Hindu, and Jain art.

name: Mumbai Gateway of India
description: Iconic arch-monument overlooking the Arabian Sea.

name: Mahabaleshwar
description: Popular hill station known for its strawberry farms, viewpoints, and pleasant climate.

name: Shirdi
description: Major pilgrimage site, home to the shrine of Sai Baba.

name: Loktak Lake
description: Largest freshwater lake in Northeast India, famous for its floating phumdis.

name: Kangla Fort
description: Historic fort, the ancient capital of Manipur.

name: Sendra Island
description: Island on Loktak Lake offering panoramic views and boating facilities.

name: Keibul Lamjao National Park
description: The only floating park in the world, home to the endangered Sangai deer.

name: Cherrapunji (Sohra)
description: Known for its heavy rainfall, living root bridges, and stunning waterfalls.

name: Living Root Bridges
description: Unique bridges handmade by Khasi tribes from living tree roots.

name: Dawki River (Umngot)
description: Famous for its crystal clear waters, offering boating and stunning views.

name: Shillong
description: Capital city, known as the "Scotland of the East" for its beautiful landscapes.

name: Aizawl
description: Capital city, perched on ridges, offering panoramic views of hills and valleys.

name: Vantawng Falls
description: Highest waterfall in Mizoram, surrounded by lush greenery.

name: Phawngpui Hills (Blue Mountain)
description: Highest peak in Mizoram, a biodiversity hotspot with orchids and rhododendrons.

name: Tam Dil Lake
description: Picturesque man-made lake, ideal for boating and picnics.

name: Kohima
description: Capital city, known for its World War II cemetery and vibrant Hornbill Festival.

name: Dzukou Valley
description: Valley of flowers, famous for trekking and seasonal blooms.

name: Hornbill Festival
description: Annual festival showcasing the rich culture and traditions of Naga tribes.

name: Mokokchung
description: Cultural hub of the Ao Naga tribe, known for its scenic beauty and traditions.

name: Puri Jagannath Temple
description: Famous Hindu temple dedicated to Lord Jagannath, part of Char Dham pilgrimages.

name: Konark Sun Temple
description: UNESCO site, a 13th-century temple shaped like a giant chariot.

name: Chilika Lake
description: Asia's largest brackish water lagoon, a haven for migratory birds.

name: Bhitarkanika National Park
description: Known for its mangrove forests, saltwater crocodiles, and diverse birdlife.

name: Golden Temple (Amritsar)
description: The holiest shrine for Sikhs, known for its stunning golden dome and langar.

name: Jallianwala Bagh
description: Historic garden and memorial of national importance, site of the 1919 massacre.

name: Wagah Border
description: India-Pakistan border crossing with a daily flag-lowering ceremony.

name: Anandpur Sahib
description: Important Sikh pilgrimage site, birthplace of the Khalsa.

name: Jaipur (Amber Fort)
description: The Pink City, known for majestic forts, palaces, and vibrant markets.

name: Udaipur
description: City of Lakes, famous for its romantic palaces, lakes, and gardens.

name: Jaisalmer
description: The Golden City, known for its magnificent fort, desert safaris, and havelis.

name: Mount Abu
description: Only hill station in Rajasthan, known for Dilwara Temples and Nakki Lake.

name: Gangtok
description: Capital city offering stunning views of Kanchenjunga, monasteries, and vibrant culture.

name: Tsomgo Lake (Changu Lake)
description: Glacial lake at high altitude, known for its scenic beauty and changing colors.

name: Nathula Pass
description: Mountain pass on the Indo-China border, offering breathtaking views.

name: Yumthang Valley
description: Valley of Flowers, known for its hot springs, meadows, and rhododendrons.

name: Meenakshi Temple (Madurai)
description: Historic Hindu temple with towering gopurams and intricate carvings.

name: Mahabalipuram
description: UNESCO site with rock-cut temples, shore temple, and rathas.

name: Ooty (Udagamandalam)
description: Popular hill station known for its tea gardens, botanical gardens, and toy train.

name: Kanyakumari
description: Southernmost tip of India, famous for Vivekananda Rock Memorial and Thiruvalluvar Statue.

name: Thiruchendur
description: Most beautiful place.

name: Charminar
description: Iconic monument and mosque in Hyderabad, a symbol of the city.

name: Ramoji Film City
description: World's largest integrated film city and popular tourist attraction.

name: Golconda Fort
description: Historic fort known for its acoustics, palaces, and diamond trade history.

name: Warangal Fort
description: 13th-century fort showcasing Kakatiya architecture and intricate carvings.

name: Ujjayanta Palace
description: Former royal palace, now a state museum, showcasing Tripura's history and culture.

name: Neermahal
description: Water palace built in the middle of Rudrasagar Lake, a blend of Hindu and Mughal architecture.

name: Jampui Hills
description: Hill range known for its orange orchards, pleasant climate, and scenic beauty.

name: Tripura Sundari Temple (Matabari)
description: One of the 51 Shakti Peethas, an important Hindu pilgrimage site.

name: Taj Mahal
description: Ivory-white marble mausoleum, a symbol of eternal love and UNESCO site.

name: Varanasi Ghats
description: Riverfront steps along the Ganges, central to Hindu rituals and spirituality.

name: Fatehpur Sikri
description: UNESCO site, a deserted Mughal city with well-preserved palaces and mosques.

name: Mathura Vrindavan
description: Twin holy cities associated with Lord Krishna, major pilgrimage destinations.

name: Rishikesh
description: Yoga Capital of the World, known for ashrams, adventure sports, and the Ganges.

name: Kedarnath
description: One of the Char Dhams, a revered Hindu shrine dedicated to Lord Shiva.

name: Valley of Flowers
description: UNESCO site, a national park known for its meadows of endemic alpine flowers.

name: Nainital
description: Popular hill station built around a mango-shaped lake, surrounded by mountains.

name: Sundarbans National Park
description: World's largest mangrove forest, home to the Bengal tiger and diverse wildlife.

name: Darjeeling
description: Hill station famous for its tea plantations, toy train, and views of Kanchenjunga.

name: Victoria Memorial
description: Grand marble building in Kolkata, a museum dedicated to Queen Victoria.

name: Kalimpong
description: Hill station offering panoramic views, Buddhist monasteries, and colonial architecture.

name: India Gate
description: War memorial arch, a prominent landmark in New Delhi.

name: Qutub Minar
description: UNESCO site, a towering minaret made of red sandstone and marble.

name: Red Fort (Lal Qila)
image: /Lal Qila or Red Fort Delhi India - Travelure .jpg
description: Historic fort that served as the main residence of Mughal emperors.

name: Akshardham Temple
description: Sprawling Hindu temple complex showcasing Indian art, culture, and spirituality.

name: Auroville
description: Experimental township dedicated to human unity and sustainable living.

name: Paradise Beach
description: Pristine beach accessible by boat, known for its golden sands and clear waters.

name: French Quarter (White Town)
description: Colonial-era streets with French architecture, boutiques, and cafes.

name: Promenade Beach
description: Popular beachfront stretch for walks, with landmarks like the War Memorial.

name: Srinagar (Dal Lake)
description: Summer capital known for Dal Lake, houseboats, Mughal gardens, and scenic beauty.

name: Gulmarg
description: Popular skiing destination with stunning meadows and the Gulmarg Gondola.

name: Pahalgam
description: Picturesque town on the banks of Lidder River, base for Amarnath Yatra.

name: Vaishno Devi
description: Major Hindu pilgrimage site dedicated to Goddess Vaishno Devi, located in Trikuta Mountains.

name: Pangong Lake
description: High-altitude lake known for its changing colors and stunning Himalayan backdrop.

name: Nubra Valley
description: High-altitude cold desert with sand dunes, Bactrian camels, and monasteries.

name: Leh Palace
description: Former royal palace overlooking the town of Leh, built in Tibetan architectural style.

name: Magnetic Hill
description: Gravity hill where vehicles appear to roll uphill, a unique natural phenomenon.

name: Havelock Island (Swaraj Dweep)
description: Famous for Radhanagar Beach, snorkeling, and scuba diving.

name: Cellular Jail
description: Former colonial prison, now a national memorial, narrating India's freedom struggle.

name: Radhanagar Beach
description: Often rated as one of Asia's best beaches, known for its white sands and turquoise waters.

name: Ross Island (Netaji Subhas Chandra Bose Dweep)
description: Former administrative headquarters, now with ruins, deer, and peacocks.

name: Rock Garden
description: Unique sculpture garden created from industrial and home waste by Nek Chand.

name: Sukhna Lake
description: Man-made reservoir, a popular spot for boating, walking, and enjoying sunsets.

name: Rose Garden (Zakir Hussain Rose Garden)
description: Asia's largest rose garden, featuring thousands of rose varieties.

name: Capitol Complex
description: UNESCO World Heritage site designed by Le Corbusier, showcasing modernist architecture.
